medical_history.chief_complaint: Necrosis and infection of the right forefoot due to vascular disease.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms developed leading to necrosis and infection of the right forefoot. Initially, an amputation of the hallux was performed, but as the infection could not be controlled, an additional amputation was necessary. Problematic vascular supply was noted prior to surgery, but collateral circulation was good.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hemodialysis due to kidney failure, chronic mitral insufficiency, pulmonary hypertension, arteriosclerosis, and a transtibial amputation on the left side.
medical_history.social_history: Before admission to the hospital, the patient lived independently and had been successfully rehabilitated after a prior amputation.
